meanings.definition: A person who is learning a trade from a skilled employer, having agreed to work for a fixed period at low wages.
meanings.sent1: The apprentices eagerly watched the blacksmith shape the metal.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter hired two apprentices to help with the woodworking projects.
meanings.sent3: The apprentices tried to hammer a nail but ended up hitting their thumbs instead.
meanings.sent4: Like seeds in a garden, apprentices grow under the guidance of their mentors.
meanings.sent5: The image of apprentices diligently working in the workshop stayed with him.

meanings.definition: To engage in learning a trade under a skilled employer.
meanings.sent1: She apprentices with a master baker to learn the art of making bread.
meanings.sent2: He apprentices at the mechanic's shop to become a skilled technician.
meanings.sent3: The young man apprentices himself to the wise old watchmaker, eager to learn.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, she apprentices under a famous pianist to perfect her skills.
meanings.sent5: To truly master a craft, one must apprentice under those who have mastered it before.
